text: Ready to Gather Here, Go Far?
Take the next step and complete the online application. The online application is the only way to apply for admission to Northeastern State University. Want more information about NSU?
For new freshman, transfer, returning, concurrent, international, and post-baccalaureate students.
If you intend to enroll in any graduate-level courses (5000 level), complete the GRADUATE application.
Please note that international undergraduate students will use this application associated with the term in which you are applying.

Beginning Summer 2020, the international graduate application is combined with the domestic graduate application, one application for all graduate students. Click on the appropriate entering semester to complete the application.
Summer 2020 Graduate Application - All Graduate Students
Fall 2020 Graduate Application - All Graduate Students
Spring 2021 Graduate Application - All Graduate Students
Have you already started or submitted an application?
Login to finish your application and check your status.
If you are a current student planning to continue taking undergraduate courses after completing your Bachelor's degree, please complete the
and submit it to the Office of the Registrar. You do not need to reapply for undergraduate admission to NSU.
If you plan to pursue a Master's degree at NSU, you will need to complete the Graduate application for Graduate College admission and submit all required documents.
If you have completed a bachelor's degree and are uncertain if you should apply using the Graduate application or Post-Baccalaureate application, please contact the
International students who do not meet admissions requirements to study English only should apply to the
If you are an international student and are uncertain if you should apply using the admissions application or the ESL Academy application, please contact
In order to use the online application for admission,
you must be able to pay the $25 non-refundable admission application fee by credit card via the online pay process at the end of the application form

. If necessary, you may save your application and return to complete it at a later time, just remember the Login ID and PIN number you create. Once you’ve submitted your application, be sure to submit all the required documents.
If you are unable to complete the online application, please contact us. Undergraduate students should contact the Office of Admissions and Recruitment at
. Graduate students should contact the Graduate College at

Northeastern State University is Oklahoma’s fourth-largest public institution, with three campuses and online programming. As the oldest institution of higher education in Oklahoma, we offer strong academics focused on career readiness and the third-lowest
of any university in the state.
With a wide variety of options, you can select from 56 exceptional undergraduate and 25 graduate
. We are also the proud home of the

, the only optometry school in Oklahoma and one of 21 in the nation. The ultimate goal for our students is success as we strive to exceed expectations from first contact to graduation, career placement and beyond.
Now that you’ve been admitted to NSU, it’s time to take your next steps.
Register to attend Tahlequah's college preview day for high school juniors and seniors, and transfer students.
Register to attend Broken Arrow's Transfer Day to enroll in classes and meeting with advising, admissions, counseling, career services, and financial aid staff to navigate your next steps.
Admission Representatives are assigned by location and student type. Whether a first-time freshman or a transfer student; our friendly staff can assist you in making the right decision for you.
You need to be admitted before you'll be awarded an NSU Scholarship.
Don't forget you can stack Oklahoma's Promise on top of any NSU scholarship.

Northeastern State University opened its third campus in 2001 in Broken Arrow, and now serves more than 3,500 juniors, seniors, and graduate students. Our beautiful campus has over 60 classrooms, 12 science labs, and 8 computer labs with modern equipment and facilities for teaching and research.

NSU Broken Arrow offers our students a choice from over 30 undergraduate degrees in business and technology, education, liberal arts, science, and health professions. We also offer 18 graduate programs including a Professional MBA, MS in Criminal Justice, MS in Higher Education Leadership, and MEd in Special Education Autism Spectrum Disorders, among many others.

A majority of our Broken Arrow students are in their late 20s and early 30s. To support these working adults, our classes are designed to to be convenient, with many offered in the evenings, online, interactive video, or in a blended formats.

Many of our students come to NSU Broken Arrow with associate's degrees from Tulsa Community College and other 2-year institutions in the region. NSU is proud to partner with these colleges to provide a seamless transfer for students to complete their bachelor's degrees at NSU.

The Tulsa-Broken Arrow metropolitan area has tremendous job opportunities for NSU graduates. The city of Broken Arrow is the third largest city in Oklahoma with a population of over 105,000. It is a vibrant and growing community with an expanding business base of manufacturing, high-tech, and aerospace industries.
